", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:

Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:

IHn: m + n = n + m

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
m: nat
n: nat
p: pos (n + m)

Goal:
pos_lr (pos_both n m p) = p

Premises:
pos_both : forall n m : nat, pos (n + m) -> pos n + pos m
pos_lr : forall n m : nat, pos n + pos m -> pos (n + m)
Notation pos := Fin.t
pos_both_lr : forall (n m : nat) (p : pos n + pos m), pos_both n m (pos_lr p) = p
pos_both_right : forall (n m : nat) (p : pos m), pos_both n m (pos_right n p) = inr p
Nat.add_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n + (m + p) = n + m + p
pos_both_left : forall (n m : nat) (p : pos n), pos_both n m (pos_left m p) = inl p
Nat.eq_add_succ : forall n m : nat, (exists p : nat, n + m = S p) < -> (exists n' : nat, n = S n') \/ (exists m' : nat, m = S m')
Nat.divide_add_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, Nat.divide n m -> Nat.divide n (m + p) -> Nat.divide n p
VectorDef.append = fix append (A : Type) (n p : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A n) (w : VectorDef.t A p) {struct v} : VectorDef.t A (n + p) := match v in (VectorDef.t _ n0) return (VectorDef.t A (n0 + p)) with | VectorDef.nil _ => w | VectorDef.cons _ a n0 v' => VectorDef.cons A a (n0 + p) (append A n0 p v' w) end : forall (A : Type) (n p : nat), VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A p -> VectorDef.t A (n + p) Arguments VectorDef.append {A}%type_scope {n p}%nat_scope
VectorSpec.replace_id : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (p : pos n) (v : VectorDef.t A n), VectorDef.replace v p (VectorDef.nth v p) = v
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.f2n = fun (n : nat) (x : pos n) => proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat x) : forall n : nat, pos n -> nat Arguments FinFun.Fin2Restrict.f2n {n}%nat_scope
Fin.depair = fix depair (m n : nat) (o : pos m) (p : pos n) {struct o} : pos (m * n) := match o in (pos n0) return (pos (n0 * n)) with | @Fin.F1 m' => Fin.L (m' * n) p | @Fin.FS n0 o' => Fin.R n (depair n0 n o' p) end : forall m n : nat, pos m -> pos n -> pos (m * n) Arguments Fin.depair {m n}%nat_scope
Nat.Odd = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m + 1 : nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Odd _%nat_scope
pos_S_inv : forall p0 : pos (S ?n), (p0 = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p0 = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos (n + m) |- nat]
Fin.of_nat : forall p n : nat, pos n + {exists m : nat, p = n + m}
Fin.FS_inj : forall x y : pos ?n, pos_nxt x = pos_nxt y -> x = y where ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos (n + m) |- nat]
Nat.Even = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m : nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Even _%nat_scope
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.restrict : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), FinFun.bFun n f -> pos n -> pos n
pos_iso : forall n m : nat, n = m -> pos n -> pos m
VectorSpec.append_splitat : forall (v : VectorDef.t ?A ?n) (w : VectorDef.t ?A ?m) (vw : VectorDef.t ?A (?n + ?m)), VectorDef.splitat ?n vw = (v, w) -> vw = VectorDef.append v w where ?A : [n : nat m : nat p : pos (n + m) |- Type] ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos (n + m) |- nat] ?m : [n : nat m : nat p : pos (n + m) |- nat]
Fin.to_nat_inj : forall p0 q : pos ?n, proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat p0) = proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat q) -> p0 = q where ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos (n + m) |- nat]
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
Fin.cast : pos ?m -> forall n0 : nat, ?m = n0 -> pos n0 where ?m : [n : nat m : nat p : pos (n + m) |- nat]
Fin.eq_dec : forall x y : pos ?n, {x = y} + {x <> y} where ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos (n + m) |- nat]
plus_is_one : forall m n : nat, m + n = 1 -> {m = 0 /\ n = 1} + {m = 1 /\ n = 0}
Fin.depair_sanity : forall (o : pos ?m) (p0 : pos ?n), proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat (Fin.depair o p0)) = ?n * proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat o) + proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat p0) where ?m : [n : nat m : nat p : pos (n + m) |- nat] ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos (n + m) |- nat]
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
